meanings.definition: The act of passing something from one person to another.
meanings.sent1: During the game, the quarterback made a quick handoff to the running back.
meanings.sent2: The nurse performed a smooth handoff of the patient's care to the night shift.
meanings.sent3: The handoff of the baton in the relay race was so fast, it looked like magic!
meanings.sent4: The handoff of responsibilities from the retiring manager to the new hire was seamless.
meanings.sent5: The handoff of the microphone from one singer to the next was flawless, creating a beautiful harmony.

meanings.definition: A play in sports where one player passes the ball to another.
meanings.sent1: The basketball team executed a perfect handoff leading to a score.
meanings.sent2: In football, the quarterback's handoff to the running back is crucial for a successful play.
meanings.sent3: The handoff of the soccer ball between teammates was like a well-choreographed dance.
meanings.sent4: The handoff of the baton in the relay race symbolized teamwork and trust.
meanings.sent5: The handoff of the puck between hockey players was lightning-fast, catching the opponents off guard.
